abstract: |
  This document presents the fishery and survey data used for the provision of stock assessment advice for offshore Scallop Fishing Areas 25 (Middle Bank, Sable Bank, and Banquereau Bank), 26 (Browns Bank North, Browns Bank South, and German Bank), and 27B (Georges Bank ‘b’). A new approach was developed for meat weight-shell height modelling, resulting in estimates of condition instead of condition factor. Age analysis of shell growth rings (increments) resulted in new von Bertalanffy growth curves for SFA 25A Sable Bank and SFA 26A Browns Bank North. Combining annual growth information from the Fisheries and Oceans Canada Maritimes Offshore Scallop Survey with commercial fishery port sampling data informed changes to the recruit size ranges for SFA 25A, 25B, 26A, and 26B. The survey indices of biomass, growth, and natural mortality provided here may be used in the observation equation of a state-space delay-difference population model.
